questions.question_text: In which of the following risk scenarios should a cloud customer have the full responsibility in all cloud service models?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
**D. Data classification risk**

Data classification risk is the responsibility of the cloud customer in all cloud service models, including Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS), Platform as a Service (PaaS), and Software as a Service (SaaS). The customer must determine how to classify their data based on its sensitivity, regulatory requirements, and business value. This classification informs how data should be handled, protected, and where it can be stored, regardless of the underlying cloud service model being used. The cloud provider typically does not have the context or understanding of the customer's data to make these classification decisions.
Answer "D" refer page 36 CCAK Study Guide.

Page 64 of CCAK Study Guide
A CSP may not be the sole provider of a cloud service. It can be part of multilevel supply chain structure that includes other (sub) cloud services. The CSP can be a provider and a customer at the same time, which can result in multilevel compliance inheritance.
Example: A well-known SaaS video on-demand provider, Netflix, uses another PaaS and IaaS cloud provider, Amazon Web Services (AWS). Any relevant Netflix compliance requirements should be communicated to AWS.

questions.question_text: In a multi-level supply chain structure where cloud service provider A relies on other sub cloud services, the provider should ensure that any compliance requirements relevant to the provider are:
A contract containing the phrase “You automatically consent to these terms by using or logging into the service to which they pertain” is establishing a contract of:

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. adhesion.

A contract of adhesion is a type of agreement where one party imposes terms on the other party, often in a take-it-or-leave-it manner, without the opportunity for negotiation. These contracts are typically used in situations where services are offered to a large number of users, such as online services, and the terms are standardized. The phrase “You automatically consent to these terms by using or logging into the service to which they pertain” indicates that the user consents to the terms simply by using the service, which is characteristic of a contract of adhesion.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is a detective control that may be identified in a Software as a Service (SaaS) service provider?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
**C. Privileged access monitoring**

Privileged access monitoring is a detective control because it involves observing and logging the activities of users with elevated privileges to detect any unauthorized or suspicious actions. This control helps in identifying potential security breaches or policy violations by monitoring access patterns and generating alerts when anomalies are detected. While network segmentation (A) and data encryption (D) are preventive controls designed to protect resources, and incident management (B) is a corrective control aimed at addressing and resolving incidents, privileged access monitoring focuses on detecting issues as they occur.

comments.content: I agree. Any malicious activity related to Privileged Access would be sent to the SIEM tool and SOC would be able to detect on time the incident.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
CCAK P# 242 Detective controls identify an incident in progress or uncover one that has already achieved its objective.
• Technical controls, such as IDSs (intrusion detection systems), monitor a network for malicious activity or policy violations.
• Any malicious activity or violation is typically reported or collected centrally using a SIEM (security information and event management) system.
• Administrative controls, such as reviewing logs, can help uncover suspicious access or activity leading to discovery of an incident.
• Physical controls, such as motion detection systems and closed-circuit television cameras, can detect the presence of an intruder after entry has occurred.
